name: UINavigationControllerDelegate
desc: Use a navigation controller delegate (a custom object that implements this protocol) to modify behavior when a view controller is pushed or popped from the navigation stack of a UINavigationController object.

items.name: func navigationController(UINavigationController, willShow: UIViewController, animated: Bool)
items.desc: Called just before the navigation controller displays a view controller’s view and navigation item properties.

items.name: func navigationController(UINavigationController, didShow: UIViewController, animated: Bool)
items.desc: Called just after the navigation controller displays a view controller’s view and navigation item properties.

items.name: func navigationController(UINavigationController, animationControllerFor: UINavigationController.Operation, from: UIViewController, to: UIViewController) -> UIViewControllerAnimatedTransitioning?
items.desc: Called to allow the delegate to return a noninteractive animator object for use during view controller transitions.

items.name: func navigationController(UINavigationController, interactionControllerFor: UIViewControllerAnimatedTransitioning) -> UIViewControllerInteractiveTransitioning?
items.desc: Called to allow the delegate to return an interactive animator object for use during view controller transitions.

items.name: func navigationControllerPreferredInterfaceOrientationForPresentation(UINavigationController) -> UIInterfaceOrientation
items.desc: Returns the preferred orientation for presentation of the navigation controller, as determined by the delegate.

items.name: func navigationControllerSupportedInterfaceOrientations(UINavigationController) -> UIInterfaceOrientationMask
items.desc: Returns the complete set of supported interface orientations for the navigation controller, as determined by the delegate.

items.name: enum UINavigationController.Operation
items.desc: These constants define the type of navigation controller transitions that can occur.
